inference:
The volume of a pyramid is $\frac{1}{3} \cdot \text{area of the base} \cdot \text{height}$.  The base of pyramid $ABCH$ is rectangle $ABCH$, which has area $1 \cdot 1 = 1$.  The height of the pyramid is the length of $AE$, which is 1.  Therefore, the volume of pyramid $ABCH$ is $\frac{1}{3} \cdot 1 \cdot 1 = \frac{1}{3}$.

Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{1}{3}}$. I hope it is correct.
